utterance.speaker: NURSE ONE
utterance.content: God, her face.

utterance.speaker: NURSE TWO
utterance.content: What happened to her?

utterance.speaker: NURSE ONE
utterance.content: I’ve got a pulse. She’s still alive. Get a gurney. Now!

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’d it go?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Where’d what go, darling?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My leftovers from Le Cirque. They were right here where this hole in the fridge is. I was going to use that Chateaubriand for my morning scramble.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, I certainly didn’t eat them. I wouldn’t look this good if I was pigging out on leftovers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes well, this isn’t the first time this has happened. Food has been going missing for the past month. It’s not just leftovers, either. It was the peanut butter, uh … artichokes, a whole quart of Mulligatawny soup, gone.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, maybe you’ve been sleep eating … again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Again? I’ve never sleep ated - sleep ate - eaten. Have I?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I’m off to class.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. How did you like that Chateaubriand? Wasn’t that a wonderful white wine reduction?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What Chateaubriand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. It’s the housekeeper. I knew it. She has been putting on weight.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Sorry, darling. She hasn’t been here for three days.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maybe there are tiny borrowers living under the floorboards who come out at night to steal your food.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not realistic. They’re too small to get the fridge door open. No, but something is going on here. And I’m going to find out what.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: So some food disappeared, Castle. What’s the big deal?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It wasn’t you, was it? I know you hate to go grocery shopping.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously, Castle? I haven’t been to your place since Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ugh. Right. Maybe my apartment’s being invaded by some kind of super rat. Whatever’s going on, I’ve taken bold steps to ensure it never happens again.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. These two nurses saw some guy do a dump and drive around 4AM. The trauma unit tried to save our vic but she didn’t make it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If he’s our killer, why take her to the ER?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he had a guilty conscience. Did the nurses get a good look at the driver?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but they did see his car. It was a blue sedan. Hospital security’s trying to get me footage to get the license plate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Set up a canvass around the hospital. We need to find someone that got a good look at the driver. And where’s our vic?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Her body’s still in the trauma bay. Word is she was pretty messed up.

utterance.speaker: SIDNEY PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Let me caution you. This is not for the faint of heart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For once I agree with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did this to her?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Could be anything from a crowbar to a box cutter. But they look like claw marks. I just can’t tell what kind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If it was an animal wouldn’t there be bite marks?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I might not find them until I do a complete exam to determine the cause of death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Given that we don’t have a crime scene, is there any indication of where she was attacked?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: No, but I can tell you one thing. Based on the inflammation, I’d say the victim sustained her injuries 5 to 6 hours before she died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: While we figure out who she is we’ll find out how she wound up this way.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Name is Anne Cardinal, 27 years old. She was Native American, she grew up on the Onondaga reservation in central New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any next of kin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, she had no siblings and both her parents are gone. She lived in off campus housing at Hudson University where she was working towards a Ph.D in evolutionary biology.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, send CSU to her apartment. Talk to friends and neighbors to see if they know of anyone in her life who drove a blue sedan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who wanted to mangle her face.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I may have an explanation for those facial wounds. Turns out our victim worked at a retirement home called Haven House.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vicious blood thirsty old folks? Is that your theory?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This home is not for people, Castle. It’s a primate sanctuary. Mostly for apes and chimpanzees and monkeys who have retired from the movie business.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I always wanted a pet monkey when I was a kid. Big Curious George fan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, wait ‘til George grows up. An adult chimpanzee can reach 200 pounds, tear off a man’s face, hands, and naughty bits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, we’re going to go to the primate sanctuary. If Anne was attacked there, maybe someone dumped her body to cover it up. And call me if you get anything on that sedan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: George would never do that!

utterance.speaker: PAUL DEVLIN
utterance.content: This is a terrible loss. Anne was a brilliant student and a lovely person.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Given her wounds, I need to ask. How much interaction did Anne have with the primates here?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Well, very little in terms of direct contact. But we have very strict training guidelines for all of our employees.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Still, I’ll need the crime scene unit to do a thorough investigation of this investigation.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Of course. Anything I can do to help.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I can’t imagine she was harmed by any of our animals. They’ve never shown any aggressive behavior toward her or anyone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now, Dr. Devlin, how well did you know Anne Cardinal?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I was her faculty advisor at Hudson University. And when I found out she was taking time off a couple of months ago, I offered her a job here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what sort of work did she do?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Well, I have a grant to study the social behavior of primates, and I hire Hudson students like her and Franco here to help manage the animals’ care.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And none of them have homicidal impulses? Not even Moonshine here?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Especially not Moonshine. He’s been around people his whole life. And he’s very social.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was the last time either of you saw Anne?

utterance.speaker: FRANCO
utterance.content: We were together yesterday. She seemed totally fine. She did leave early. That wasn’t like her. Said she had something important to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she say what it was?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: It might have something to do with that argument she had.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What argument?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I saw her in the parking garage around lunchtime talking to a man. I’d never seen him before, but he seemed very angry with her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think you could describe him to a sketch artist?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Yeah, I most definitely could.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I know who the killer is. Did you see how that gorilla looked at me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I think it was lust, actually, Castle. You are ruggedly handsome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Blood lust, maybe. Don’t let Moonshine fool you. I’m betting he and his fellow retirees are actually super intelligent apes plotting to take over New York City. They’re going to round up all the people, put us in a sanctuary. Most likely Anne got on to them – – they took her out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now if this monkey cabal really wanted to get Anne out of the picture, why did they drop her off at the hospital?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, obviously they were conflicted. It’s a complicated relationship between man and primate. Didn’t you see Rise of the Planet of the Apes? Cautionary tale.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry to burst your bubble, Castle, but CSU hasn’t found a crime scene at Haven House. Anne wasn’t attacked there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, where was the attack? And by what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So uh, a witness saw a blue sedan take out a side mirror about a block away from our hospital, and they got a plate. The owner of the car was Eddie Maslon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How is he connected to Anne?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m not really sure, but Eddie knows how to put the hurt on people. He just did eight years in Sing Sing for murder two. And he had a way to mess up Anne’s face. City records show he had a pit bull named Badass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A convicted killer with an attack dog? All right. Pick him up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Damnit. I really liked Moonshine for this.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE MASLON
utterance.content: I’ve never seen her before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You dumped her outside of the ER last night, except she looked more like this. Your dog do that to her? Eddie, you’ve been out of prison for three months. You better start talking unless you want to go back.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Okay, look. I didn’t touch her. And neither did Badass. Whatever did that to her, that wasn’t no dog.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then how’d she end up in your car?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I was leaving a bar last night and I happened to make a wrong turn down an alleyway. And I saw her lying there. She was all messed up. I couldn’t just leave her there to die.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so you’re a good Samaritan now?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: If I wanted to kill her then why would I bring her to a hospital?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you wanted to save her why would you ditch her outside of one?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Because with my record I knew I’d get blamed, which is exactly what’s happening now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: No good deed, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Then why don’t you tell me where you supposedly found her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s blood. Maybe Eddie was telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett? You need to see this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the - ?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Footprints. Giant footprints made by some kind of beast. Those vicious claw marks? Savage wounds. Her blood. These footprints. It all adds up to one thing. She was killed by Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously, Beckett? Do you have any idea what this means? We are about to be the first people in the nation - no, the world – to solve a Bigfoot murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Very funny, Castle. But there is no such thing as Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell that to the people who’ve been sighting him for 400 years.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: So I typed the blood. It’s a match to our victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Never mind the blood. What is your opinion on these?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Professionally I can’t speculate what those are, Mr. Castle, but personally I can say that anyone who believes in Bigfoot is an ass.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that is a common assertion amongst the uninformed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, buddy. Let’s say there is a Bigfoot. How does a giant hairy ape man get around the city unseen?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Easy. Follow the big, fat footprints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Subway access tunnel. Since Hurricane Sandy a lot of those are still closed, so Bigfoot’s been using them to get around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you say – look at these footprints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These are the footprints I’m interested in. They’re near where the body was. CSU said that they were made within the last 24 hours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could be Eddie Maslon’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A size 13? The guy’s too short to have feet this big. No, these boot prints are our best lead. These prints. Not the tracks from the giant clown feet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, let’s go to a crime scene and ignore the evidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re saying someone framed Bigfoot?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Al I’m saying, Castle, is that someone, a human being, left the Bigfoot prints in that alleyway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and staged the crime scene to make it look as though Bigfoot was the killer. Why go through the trouble of blaming Bigfoot, a creature select few of us even believe exists, never mind could be a murder suspect.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Speaking of suspects, Anne’s boss came through with a sketch of the guy she argued with the day she died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take a look, Castle. A person of interest. Emphasis on the word ‘person’. Talk to Anne’s friends and family and see if anyone recognizes him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um, I wouldn’t rule out Bigfoot just yet. Turns out there have been dozens of reported Bigfoot sightings in the city in the past couple months.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that right? Why, Detective Ryan, tell us about this new and extraordinary development.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Like this woman in Brooklyn. She says that Bigfoot tried to break into her apartment – on the second floor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gentlemen! I hate to rain on your parade –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. But here’s the reason that Bigfoot reports have spiked. Two months ago a TV show, Mission: Monster, put out a million dollar reward for the capture and/or proof that Bigfoot exists.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See, Castle? All of this evidence that you claim proves Bigfoot’s existence is actually people angling for money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re saying it’s just a coincidence that Anne was working with primates and was mysteriously killed where Bigfoot prints were found?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not a coincidence. Just a hoax.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If it’s such a hoax then tell me why I found this. I dug through her phone records. Turns out, the last phone call she ever made was to Darrell Meeks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Darrell Meeks?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just a world-reknowned cryptozoologist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a scientist who searches for as yet undiscovered creatures.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Such as unicorns and centaurs?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Banshees and leprechauns?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Doctor Meeks happens to be the foremost authority on Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And lo and behold, she called him on the very day that she died. Still think Bigfoot has nothing to do with this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Perlmutter’s got something for us. Why don’t you guys head over there? Castle and I’ll talk to the world’s foremost authority on Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Oh. The B team.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Talk about the B team.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I’d hoped to see Castle’s look of dismay when I told him cause of death was nothing more exotic than blunt force trauma to the cranium. It seems she was clobbered over the head with a club or a pipe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You could have said so over the phone.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Ah, but I also made two highly intriguing discoveries.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: About the wounds on her face?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Well… their cause is still undetermined. But a far greater interest is that –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because they could be claw marks. Bigfoot has claws.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So does Wolverine. Is he real?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Are you done? I found this glass embedded in her head wound. It has an anti-reflective coating, like on prescription glasses.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But she didn’t wear glasses. So where did it come from?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: All I can tell you is that it was practically hammered into her skull by whatever hit her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll send it in for analysis.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Yeah well, you should take this while you’re at it. I found that in her stomach.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A pendant? In her stomach?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: It appears she swallowed it 5 to 6 hours before she died.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The same time she was attacked. Why would she swallow it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe she knew she was going to die. She was trying to send a message.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or she was trying to keep this pendant from her killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you take this photo?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL MEEKS
utterance.content: Yes, it’s an expedition I led in western Canada. It’s the closest I’ve ever gotten to him in 23 years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Meeks, you were the last person that Anne spoke with just before she died. Why did she call you?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Yes, I – I think she called me to ask if I thought if Bigfoot would venture into an urban area.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what did you tell her?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Well, given development and urban encroachment on wilderness, sooner or later it was inevitable. And I suspect that she had evidence of the presence of Bigfoot here in the city.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t understand why she would talk to you about something like that.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Well, Anne was studying evolutionary biology. She was an honors student at the university. But she was actually a hugely respected Bigfoot expert.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: She even gave me that extremely rare Yeti finger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you saying Anne was a Bigfoot hunter?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: No, no, no. No, not a hunter, no. Uh, Anne was Native American. And uh, in her tribe’s culture a Bigfoot was considered benevolent or a protector. When she was a child she actually saw a Bigfoot and so after that after that she devoted her life to their study. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So are Bigfoots – uh, Bigfeet – uh, violent or aggressive?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Well, they certainly can be. What were the nature of her injuries?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh –

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Well, I mean, was she attacked by a Bigfoot?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not a chance.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Well, in the name of science, would you allow me to examine where she died?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Now, as far as you’re aware, did she have issues with anyone? Other than Bigfoot?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Uh, well, she was under a very high level of scrutiny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scrutiny from whom?

utterance.speaker: GARLAND MEEKS
utterance.content: Oh, some TV show offered a million dollar reward, which unleashed a tide of idiots all searching for Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Yes, and this is my wife Garland. Uh, she’s the skeptical one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trust me, I feel your pain. Pleasure.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: On the case, I think when people found out Anne’s area of expertise, they wanted to follow her to see if she would actually take them to a real Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, the day that she died Anne was seen arguing with this man. Do you recognize him?

utterance.speaker: GARLAND
utterance.content: Oh, yes. All too well.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: This man is the Bigfoot community’s worst enemy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His name is Chase Diggins and he’s an Australian adventurer and big game hunter.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Kind of Crocodile Dundee meets Indiana Jones meets Ted Nugent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now according to the Meeks, he’s violent and highly unstable.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s more is that this guy is hell bent on bagging a Bigfoot. I found him on Youtube bragging about how he was going to mount one on his wall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we have anything other than speculation on a mythical ape man that will connect him to the murder?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We have this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Diggins has a prosthetic hook for a hand?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Says he lost it in a Bigfoot attack and he almost –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: However it happened - - that hook could have been what did a number on Anne’s face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s Chase Diggins now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy is an international adventurer. What the hell is he doing renting an industrial craphole like this? Why not a hotel?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The guy hunts Bigfoot. I don’t think that rational behavior is something he’s familiar with.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa. Did you hear that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude, there’s something down there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Chase Diggins! NYPD! If you’re down here you better identify yourself right now!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude, I’ve got a bad feeling about this thing, man. I – I don’t think that we should –

utterance.speaker: CHASE DIGGINS
utterance.content: You gents looking for me?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Bloody shame about Anne. She was one hell of a tracker. Actually, the only reason I cane to the city. Word was, she knew the whereabouts of an actual ‘squatch and I figured she might lead me to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You came to New York to hunt Bigfoot?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You see this, Detective? Nepal, 2008. Rocky crags for the Himalayas. ‘squatch came out of nowhere and ripped my arm clean off. So I will hunt down every last one of those bastards until I have my payback.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did it look like?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: 500 pounds of fur and death, mate. Eyes like a rabid dog, but smart. Anyway, they say that she found one. Everyone knew it, but Anne wasn’t talking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that why you went to see her?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Who told you that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Witnesses saw you and Anne arguing outside of her work yesterday.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Merely a polite conversation between colleagues.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? ‘cause later that night she turned up dead.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You’re squatting in the wrong bush, Detective. I was at a target range last night with my mates. Keeping my aim sharp. You can check it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s funny, ‘cause we found a bootprint in an alleyway near Anne’s blood with the same tread as the boots you’re wearing now.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: All right, look. I was in that alley. But not last night. It was the night before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What were you doing there?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Well, I figured she was tracking the beast, so I tracked her. I followed her to the alley and that’s when I caught the wily b*tch in the act.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The act of what?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Stamping fake ‘squatch prints in the ground is what. Using molds of giant feet. She was faking the damn evidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh – whoa – hang on. Anne was a respected researcher. Why would she fake evidence of Bigfoot?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Because I reckon she found the real thing. She was trying to throw the rest of us off the scent, but I was on to her so I confronted her at work. Offered her anything she wanted, but she told me to bugger off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what I think? You faked that site because somewhere in your twisted mind it makes sense that the expert on Bigfoot would be killed by one.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I knew it. She found him. Little b*itch found my Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, he’s either crazy or he’s lying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’d go with crazy, because it looks like he’s telling the truth. Tests on his prosthetic hook show no trace of Anne’s DNA. And his alibi checks out, so it’s not him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it looks like we’re back to this guy as our number one suspect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, could you please take that down?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The lab also was able to identify the glass shards we found in our victim’s head wound. It’s from a camera lens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There was no camera at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe our killer took it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which would explain why there’re so few photos of Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I meant our human killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s recanvass near that alleyway. See if we can find that camera.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so I looked into that pendant Anne swallowed and I found something strange.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I talked to her friends and neighbors. The pendant wasn’t Anne’s. It belonged to Justine Bolton, Anne’s roommate at Hudson University last year.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does the roommate have any idea what Anne was doing with it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah … I’d love to ask her. There’s only one problem. Justine was murdered a year ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And a year later her pendant is found in her murdered friend’s stomach?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That can’t be a coincidence . What do we know about Justine’s murder?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I ordered up her case files. They should be here by morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Castle, I don’t care how much research you do, you’re not going to convince me that there’s a Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just follow the evidence and the insanely large footprints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there anything that you don’t believe in?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure there is. There’s … um …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, well, what about you? If not Bigfoot or zombies or ghosts, what do you believe in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just – I believe in the everyday magic of life. I mean, things that I can see and touch, like um … the green shoots that pop through the snow in February or the Flatiron building or the way that I feel when I hear Coltrane. It’s –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I can appreciate the everyday, but why not live in the possible? The world just doesn’t have as many mysteries anymore. There’s no new continents to explore. There’s no more deepest, darkest Africa. Everything’s all mapped out by satellites and sonar, yet still people reach for the unknown. It’s what makes us grow. Coltrane wouldn’t have had that saxophone if Antoine Sax hadn’t imagined it. Isn’t that what separates us from uh, say, Moonshine?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well you know, there is one – – inexplicable, mysterious phenomenon that I do believe in still. Us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something set off my trap!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You set a trap?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got you now, you super rat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one steals from me!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s still not taking my calls.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, can you blame her, Castle? You practically turned her into a Smurf.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Na’vi would be a more contemporary reference. No, the point is, she lied to me. She looked me right in the eye and she blamed the Borrowers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sure she had a good reason.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For what? Not having food? I mean, I give her a sizable allowance and if that’s not enough, she can always ask for more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like I said, Castle. There are plenty of mysteries in the everyday. Hey, Ryan? Has Justine Bolton’s murder file come in yet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, she was attacked in the apartment that she shared with Anne Cardinal. The way she was choked and bruised looked like it was a crime of passion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did they have a suspect?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unfortunately he fled. And he hasn’t been seen since the murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any chance he had long shaggy hair and he was 8 feet tall?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, no. Sorry, Castle. It was Justine’s boyfriend, Kurt Wilson. He was the one that supposedly found the body. He was a football player with a history of assaults on and off the field. It looked like Justine was trying to get away from him. One the day that she was murdered she contacted the dean and told him that she was dropping out of school even though she was top of her class. By the time the cops realized that all roads led to Kurt Wilson, he disappeared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How does Anne figure into this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, as her roommate it looks like Anne took Justine’s death pretty hard. When I spoke to the lead detective he told me she came to him a few months back and asked to Justine’s case file. He refused since it’s a pending murder case, but still it means –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anne was looking into Justine’s murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And a few months ago, that’s when Anne took time off school.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then maybe Anne wasn’t tracking down Bigfoot. She was looking for Kurt Wilson.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe she found him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Canvass didn’t turn up Anne’s camera, but the lab came back with a serial number on that lens. Now it was made for a specific model – a wifi enabled camcorder that’s designed to sync up to a cloud account. I checked; Anne has a cloud account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we access it?

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: Testing … one, two, three. Okay, good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at the time stamp.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: 12:20AM. The night she died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but she’s not in an alley. Where the hell is she?

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: He’s after me! He’s after me!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the attack took place in the woods, not that alley. But what we need to find out is where these woods are.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tech is trying to get the geodata off that footage to see if we can pinpoint the exact coordinates.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If she was attacked in the woods somewhere why move her to an alley?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because the killer was trying to throw us off his trail. If Anne was looking for Kurt Wilson then the last thing he would want to do is leave her body near the same spot where he was hiding out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless she as looking for someone else in those woods.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Something with fur?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do we really see of our killer in this video? He’s dark, looming, powerful. Holding a primitive weapon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that is a person.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All I see is the silhouette of a hulking humanoid form. Of Darrell Meeks and that one-armed Ozzie were right and Anne did know where Bigfoot was, well that could be him on that video.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then what, Bigfoot carried her body into the city on foot from wherever these woods are and left her in that alleyway?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you said yourself, Kurt Wilson wouldn’t want to leave Anne’s body where he’d been hiding out. Why would Bigfoot?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Why don’t you circulate Kurt’s photo to Anne’s family and friends and see if anyone has seen him around. Castle and I will talk to tech to see if we can figure out where these woods are.

utterance.speaker: FRANCO
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe. If you rough him up a little he could be that homeless guy I saw hanging out in the parking garage.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: When was that?

utterance.speaker: FRANCO
utterance.content: Last week sometime.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was he doing?

utterance.speaker: FRANCO
utterance.content: Nothing, man. He just looked like he was waiting.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’re going to need security cam footage of the garage.

utterance.speaker: FRANCO
utterance.content: It’s run by a separate company. I’ll get you their number.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If Wilson knew that Anne was after him he might have been following her. Preparing to kill her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll set up a canvass and pull traffic cam footage from that area. Maybe we can get a hit on where he went after he left that garage.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: Testing … one, two, three. Okay, good.

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: The camera started syncing to her account right when she started filming. We couldn’t pull any geodata, but the sync was routed through her cell phone. It pinged off this cell tower here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are they any woods near that tower?

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: Yes, in a 10,000 acre nature preserve called Branch Cross.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a perfect hangout for Bigfoot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or a fugitive. Now is there any way to narrow down where she was when this was being filmed?

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: Not as much as I’d like, but I checked with the forest service. The species of tree in the video grow mostly in this 6 square mile are. Also between the moon’s position in the sky and the orientation of the shadows I can tell you that she was moving in a south easterly direction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. She’s good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh… could you turn up the volume on the video?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you guys hear that in the background?

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: He’s after me. Oh God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think you could isolate that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That sounds like water. Are there any streams or rivers nearby?

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: Right there. She must have been near that creek, which gets us down to a 2 square mile area.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the good news is we have our crime scene. The bad news is it’s in 2 square miles of remote wilderness with no access by road. You up for a hike?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh I’m well equipped for a hike.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Knocking on wood and vocalizing. It’s how Bigfoot communicates over long distances and how the real Bigfoot hunters lure him out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, the real police don’t do it so our human fugitive won’t know that we’re coming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, trust me. Kurt Wilson has been hiding out here for a year. We are not gonna find him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we’re close. GPS is showing that this is the general area of the attack. We just need to find some landmarks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It happened by this downed tree, so all we’ve gotta do is find the tree and we’ve found our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! Castle, please. No more Wookie calls.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not Wookie. I’m not doing Wookie. I can’t do Wookie. Alexis does a really cute Wookie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, whatever you’re doing could you stop?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you scared it might work?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I’m scared that I might murder you and then I’ll have two crime scenes on my hands.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, a lot of highly respected individuals believe in Bigfoot. Teddy Roosevelt wrote about him in his journals. Jane Goodall has gone on record saying that she’s open to the possibility. And right now, as we speak, professors at Oxford are studying Bigfoot DNA samples. No, it is possible. You just have to be open to it. Because at any moment life can surprise you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ugh, that is not good for my knee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Where are we?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s some kind of trap.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which we’ve got to get out of. Castle, do you have anything in your vest that can help us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah, heck, I’ve got a guppie multitool, I’ve got a solar powered hand fan, got camo glasses, built in compass, snake bite kit –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So nothing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well not nothing. I can build a fire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Castle. I can pull myself out if you can boost me up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then how am I going to get out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have a rope in the car. I was going to hike back and get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re going to leave me here alone? ‘kay, whoa, just hold on a second. Let’s just back up and think about this. What is

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Something Castle? You think that Bigfoot came out here with a shovel?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you’re probably right. I don’t think Bigfoot built this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, some hunters or poachers probably dug it up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hunting what? Look at the size of this thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe our fugitive built it in case anyone came out here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was more comfortable with the idea of Bigfoot building it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle. Why don’t you pop a squat? We’ll pull a cheerleader move.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Will you be wearing a short skirt for this? That’s the rule.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, this pit is kind of crudely built. Some primates have been known to – make – they have been known to use tools to trap prey –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could you stand still? Holy –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m just saying I don’t want to end up as Bigfoot dinner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Castle. There is a bit of poetic justice in this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Poetic justice how?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I mean, think about it. You set a trap for Alexis and now someone – or something – has set one for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Promise me you’ll come back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In case I don’t make it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh … that’s cute. But seriously, hurry back!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘kay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing. What do you got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Grab your coat. We got a hit on that photo of Kurt Wilson. One of Anne’s neighbors just saw him go into her apartment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Wilson. NYPD.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Woohoohoo. Not much of a running back there, Wilson. But then, you’re out of training.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We got him. And he’s not talking. What do you want us to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, check his clothes for Anne’s blood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’re you guys doing on the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … we ran into a little snag. But when we find it hopefully we find evidence that leads us straight to Kurt Wilson and we won’t need him to talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, spork. They all laughed at you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stupid –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett? Thank God you are back. What took you so long?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ha ha ha ha ha. Okay, get me out of here now. Beckett? Ka –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Help!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Help! Help. Please … don’t eat me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Police! Turn around! Put your hands up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, what are you doing? Are you crazy? He can’t understand you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Shoot it! Shoot it! What are you waiting for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. It’s talking.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Don’t shoot! Don’t shoot! Don’t shoot! Please don’t shoot!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t shoot him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well this is a huge disappointment.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: No, this is a big misunderstanding!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it? Because those claws could have easily caused Anne’s injuries.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: What? I would never hurt Anne.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you expect us to believe that with you dressed up in this … getup … right in the same area she was attacked?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Wait, she was attacked here? I – I – I thought she was attacked in the city.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: O – o – okay, okay. This looks bad. Let – let me just try and explain, okay? I knew that Anne was coming out here on her own and – and I – I admit that I followed her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Because I think she found Bigfoot!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe she just found an idiot dressed up as Bigfoot then killed her.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: No! I didn’t hurt Anne!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, okay. So you just stalked her?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Look, I just – I just wanted – just this once – to lay eyes on this elusive beast. And – and that’s why I – I built this man trap and – and I’m in this suit, drenched in deer musk –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that what that is?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s an attractant. It lures them out. And it’s working, too! I mean, about an hour ago I – I heard vocalizations and knocking on wood. And those are – are classic Bigfoot mating calls.

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: And I found some half-eaten food and some scat. And not to mention a tool that Bigfoot used to club his prey. And there was blood on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. You saw a bloody club?

utterance.speaker: DARRELL
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Show us where you found it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize this? That’s Anne Cardinal’s blood. We’re checking your clothes for it, too, along with the dirt that is going to place you in the woods.

utterance.speaker: KURT WILSON
utterance.content: You’re just like those other cops. You’d rather make your case than see the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then what is the truth, Kurt?

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: I was living out in those woods. But Anne wasn’t trying to hunt me down. She came out there to help me, to bring me food and supplies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would Anne help the man that murdered her roommate?

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: A few months ago I came out of hiding to find Anne. I told her that I was innocent, that I didn’t kill Justine, and I begged her to look into the case. And she agreed to because she believed me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’m a little more skeptical.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can vouch for that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have a history of violence, Kurt. And it’s pretty clear that Justine dropped out and tried to break up with you so you killed her.

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: Justine did not drop out to get away from me. She and I were in love. When she told me she was quitting Hudson, I decided to go, too. The two of use were planning on transferring to another school. We had even toured the campus at SUNY Binghamton the week before. And I’m sure they have a record of that somewhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you weren’t the reason why Justine left Hudson, then what was?

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: She never told me. She just said that things weren’t working out. And I’ve spent a lot of time thinking about that. And the only thing that makes sense is if there was someone there that she was afraid of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like who?

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: A classmate. A professor. I don’t know. But I think Anne found out. Last week when I came to see her at her work she said she was close to having answers. And the next thing I know, she’s dead. So I figure whoever did it killed Justine, too. And that’s why – why I broke into her apartment. I was looking for … I don’t know. Clues, answers … anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The person that you think killed Anne and Justine, do you have any idea who it is?

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: It had to be someone that could talk Justine into opening her door. You know, someone that she knew. That’s the only reason they would steal her necklace. It wasn’t worth anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You wouldn’t be referring to a lapis pendant, would you?

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: Justine never took it off. When I found her, that pendant was gone. Whoever killed her took it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kurt, is this Justine’s pendant?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why Anne had it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The pendant is proof. She found the real killer. It has to be someone she spent time with recently. Someone she got close to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Professor Devlin?

utterance.speaker: PAUL DEVLIN
utterance.content: Can I help you with something, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, you can. What can you tell us about Justine Bolton?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: She was a student at Hudson who died rather tragically.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you knew her as more than that. She took your introduction to anthropology class her freshman year.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Yes she did. Which made her loss a personal one. But I fail to see what that –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you aware that after she took that course she told her counselor that she was afraid because of someone on campus. She never said who. But someone was obsessed with her.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Well no doubt she was talking about her boyfriend. The young man who killed her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, but she took the meeting with her counselor before she met her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But she had met you. You’ve had an odd career, Professor. You taught at four schools in six years so I made a few inqueries and there were intimations of stalking, sexual harassment, and even worse.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: All of which were false! And let me point out, no action was ever taken against me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Justine had scheduled a meeting with the dean on the day that she was killed to explain why she was leaving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You couldn’t let her take that meeting. If she did your dirty history would be exposed. You’d be finished. So you killed her. And being the predator that you are, you took a souvenir. Her pendant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With all the suspicion on Kurt Wilson no one was looking at you. Until Anne came along.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anne found that pendant. She knew it was you. And when she went into the woods, you followed her.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: What woods? I wasn’t in any woods.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We checked your phone records. Your cell pinged the same tower as Anne’s did around the time that she was attacked. That places you at the crime scene. We also found a club with Anne’s blood on it and someone else’s DNA. And based on the look you’re giving me right now, I’m pretty damn sure it’s yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Castle, are you disappointed that there’s no Bigfoot after all?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I’m not so sure there isn’t. I’m thinking maybe he’s out there somewhere. And if he is, I’m hoping to see him one day. Preferably from a safe distance.

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: Thank you. For finishing what Anne started. Because of you guys, Justine’s killer will pay for what he did to her and I’m a free man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what’s next for you?

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: I’m going to continue Anne’s work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re going to research Bigfoot? Why?

utterance.speaker: KURT
utterance.content: Well when she suggested I hide out in those woods she said I’d have company out there. She was right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you hear that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I gotta go get my outfit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. Hey. You um, you still got a little – on your – I’m – I’m so sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Do you know how humiliating that was?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I swear, I had no idea it was you. But Alexis, why were you stealing food?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Because I ran out of money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How could you have possibly spent all your money? Unless … wait, no …are you … are you in some kind of trouble?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I didn’t spend it. I gave it away. Invested it, really.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Invested in what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: My friend Jonah at school has a crowdfunding campaign to plant bamboo forests on the roofs of skyscrapers to help clean the air.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, why didn’t you just come to me?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Because I didn’t want the speach.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t – what speech?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That people like us need to be careful with the kind of money we have. People might try to take advantage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that speech. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you believe in all these unbelievable things, like Bigfoot. And I don’t judge. But I believe in people, in that that can accomplish. I believe in Jonah and his vision and I wanted to support him. I think he could make a real difference in the world. And okay, maybe it was stupid to give him all of my allowance, but I’m not the first person to do something stupid for something they believe in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, you’re not. Matter of fact, it’s a bit of a family trait. But … you do owe me a Chateaubriand, so let’s go to Le Cirque. And then call this Jonah guy. Have him meet us. I’d like to hear about how he’s going to change the world.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I believe in people, too.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And Borrowers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Bigfoot.
